sense.name: build, make by combining materials or parts
sense.commentary: Note: May be concrete or abstract
sense.examples: Our house is constructed mostly of brick. The parts for the computers are constructed in Asia. They are trying to construct a stable government. They have constructed different theories to explain global warming. To know how to write clearly you must understand how to construct a sentence. We need to help students learn to ask how someone has constructed an argument, a musical score, or a visual image.

sense.name: trace, draw
sense.examples: Construct a tangent to the circle. He constructed two equilateral triangles.

sense.name: suppose, reconstruct,
sense.examples: The police couldn't construct the order of events after the woman left the apartment. We tried to construct a motive for why he quit his job so suddenly.
